snippet: Democrats expelled one indicted lawmaker, held fast to another and reaffirmed their support for an embattled Bronx power broker.
abstract: Democratic primary voters in Queens reject indicted State Sen Malcolm A Smith and elect Leroy Comrie in landslide; State Sen John L Sampson, indicted on embezzlement charges, wins Brooklyn primary; State Sen Tony Avella wins tight race against former New York City Comptroller John Liu; Independent Democrat leader Sen Jeffrey D Klein of the Bronx fends off challenge by G Oliver Koppell.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Matt Flegenheimer, Dan Glaun, Kate Pastor, Nate Schweber and Nikita Stewart.

lead_paragraph: Democrats expelled one indicted lawmaker, held fast to another and reaffirmed their support for an embattled Bronx power broker.

headline.main: Democrats Reject Indicted State Senator in Queens but Renominate One in Brooklyn
headline.print_headline: Democrats Reject Indicted State Senator in Queens but Renominate One in Brooklyn
